quibble

Class EventController

  • java.lang.Object
    • quibble.BaseController
      • quibble.EventController

  • public class EventController
extends BaseController
    The EventController class handles all methods involving event management. This class provides the functionality to create or delete events. The EventController extends the BaseController.
    Since:
    2015-10-20
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Gabrielle Quilliam, Hassan Haq
    See Also:
    BaseController

    • Method Detail

      • Create

        public static void Create(SessionStorage session,
                          java.io.BufferedReader r)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This is a privileged transaction (only accessible for administrative users). Creates an event. The create method creates a new create transaction and gives a success message to the user. The transaction is created by calling the GetTransactionDetails method in the BaseController.
        Parameters:
        session - The current session data.
        r - The buffered reader to get user input.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Handles invalid user input.
        See Also:
        BaseController.GetTransactionDetails(SessionStorage, BufferedReader, boolean, boolean, String)

      • Delete

        public static void Delete(SessionStorage session,
                          java.io.BufferedReader r)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        This is a privileged transaction (only accessible for administrative users). Deletes an event. The delete method creates a new delete transaction and gives a success message to the user. The transaction is created by calling the GetTransactionDetails method in the BaseController.
        Parameters:
        session - The current session data.
        r - The buffered reader to get user input.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Handles invalid user input.
        See Also:
        BaseController.GetTransactionDetails(SessionStorage, BufferedReader, boolean, boolean, String)
